intro: Malapoenna bandongana, commonly known as the Malapoenna bandongana, is a unique plant native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers and hairy, broad leaves. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soil. Due to its rarity, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
